algorithm_technique: Iterate and find top-left corner, then expand to find bottom-right
In-place modification to mark visited farmland
problem_summary_simple: Find the top-left and bottom-right coordinates of all rectangular farmland groups.
problem_summary_technical: Scan the grid, identify the top-left '1', expand to find the bottom-right '1', and mark visited cells.
key_insights: A farmland group starts at the first '1' encountered when scanning row by row, column by column.
Once the top-left '1' is found, expand downwards and rightwards to find the extent of the rectangle.
Marking visited farmland cells (e.g., changing '1' to '-1') prevents re-processing and ensures each group is counted once.
